result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony D. Mazzara was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony D. Mazzara is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Anthony D. Mazzara was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Submit to DNA sample.  No contact with C.D.  May not use Internet or computer without agent's consent.  Undergo any counseling per agent.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony D. Mazzara in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Defendant Anthony D. Mazzara in custody.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea to Count 1.  State gives joint recommendation.  Attorney Martinez agrees.  Defendant agrees and understands.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Victim statement reviewed.  C.D. makes statement to court. State gives final statement.  Attorney Martinez makes final statement.  Court withholds sentence.

24 months Probation, concurrent.
